comment.author: 47044499@N03
comment._content: What a wonderful sight this must have been - and still is.

comment.author: 24101413@N03
comment._content: The aircraft on the left,G-ADHK, is the Short S.21 "Maia", which was used to carry the smaller S.20 seaplane (named "Mercury") piggy-back style.  The aircraft in the background is another Short flying boat (but not "Mercury").

comment.author: 95856510@N00
comment._content: There is no "small seaplane" in this photo.

comment.author: 38401430@N06
comment._content: Here is a view of both - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Short_Mayo_Composite It is of course here where Irish Coffee was invented to prevent sea sickness in passengers making the boat transfer to the aircraft.

comment.author: 74784995@N00
comment._content: The closest flying-boat is' Maia' the bottom half of the Mayo Composite....the distant one may be Empire Flying-Boat Caledonia...do you have a larger scan to read the name?
